message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest major depression, and among the options, Fluoxetine is contraindicated because of the patient’s history of erectile dysfunction. Fluoxetine may exacerbate this condition, so it should be avoided.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has symptoms of major depressive disorder and also reports erectile dysfunction, which may be worsened by some antidepressants. Fluoxetine is known to cause sexual dysfunction, so it should be avoided in this patient. All other options are safe to use in patients with erectile dysfunction.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Patients with depression and erectile dysfunction may benefit from medication that doesn’t interfere with libido or sexual function. Fluoxetine is known to cause sexual dysfunction and should be avoided in this case. Vortioxetine, Bupropion, and Vilazodone are considered to have a lower risk of sexual side effects.
